title: Conagra Expects Higher Inflation, Posts Lower Quarterly Profit
sub_head: Packaged-foods company expects organic net sales for fiscal 2022 to rise about 1%
body:
Conagra Brands Inc. said it expects higher inflation for its full year and posted lower quarterly profit, as sales slipped from last yearâ€™s surge in at-home food demand due to the Covid-19 pandemic.
The Chicago packaged-foods company behind Slim Jim meat sticks and PAM cooking spray on Thursday said it expects gross inflation to be about 11% for fiscal 2022, compared with its prior outlook of about 9%. Conagra said it plans to continue adjusting prices and taking cost-saving measures.
